abstract: Author Ray Robinson remembers New York Giants outfielder Bobby Thomson on the 60th anniversary of his ninth-inning home run on Oct 3, 1951, to give team the National League title over Brooklyn Dodgers; some people say the so-called 'Shot Heard Round The World' is the most dramatic moment in baseball history.
snippet: Bobby Thomson gave the Giants the National League title with a ninth-inning home run on Oct. 3, 1951, that some have called the most dramatic moment in baseball history.
lead_paragraph: Bobby Thomson gave the Giants the National League title with a ninth-inning home run on Oct. 3, 1951, that some have called the most dramatic moment in baseball history.

headline.main: A Signature Home Run Balanced by Humility
headline.print_headline: A Signature Home Run Balanced by Humility
headline.seo: Bobby Thomson’s Homer Balanced by Humility
